intro: Jamesbrittenia pallida, commonly known as the pale jamesbrittenia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, pale yellow flowers and heart-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
